result.execSummary:
The defendant Maurice Adidas Campbell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis, if not already done so. Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges of this case including DNA surcharge during term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- No Contact with firearms. Court advises the defendant he cannot possess firearms.

- Attend and successfully complete a Parenting class.
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Random screens.
- No drugs without a valid prescription.
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation.
- No unsupervised contact with M.C. and/or N.Q. until parenting class has been successfully completed.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Attend the probation review hearing on 11-06-15.

timeConds.notes: STAYED; for the use at the discretion of the probation department

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges as ordered in Count 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maurice Adidas Campbell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Maurice Adidas Campbell in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 11-06-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements to the Court by Lettie C., the State, defense counsel and defendant as to sentencing.
COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis - if not already done so

As to Count 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 9  MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; credit for Zero days served.

As to Count 3:
Court ordered defendant to serve 19  DAYS in the House of Correction; credit for 19 days; TIME SERVED.

As to Count 1:
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS with the following conditions:
- Court ordered 30 days in the House of Correction; stayed for the use at the discretion of the probation department.
- Attend and successfully complete a Parenting class
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
- Absolute Sobriety
- Random screens
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation
- No unsupervised contact with M.C.  and/or  N.Q.  until parenting class has been successfully completed
- Obtain/Maintain employment 
- Pay all costs, fees, assesssments and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment
- No contact with firearms
- Attend the probation review hearing on 11-06-2015

Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Maurice Adidas Campbell in court with Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs, appearing for Atty. Ann Heaps.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Count 1 and Count 3:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms.  

As to Count 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Maurice Adidas Campbell in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Abbey Marie DeSiato on behalf of Matthew Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
BRANCH 25 FOR BRANCH 40. Case set for plea hearing. Parties are still in negotiations and defense requested an adjourned plea and sentencing date. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Case set for plea hearing.  Court is in trial.  Branch 25 agreed to take the case.  Matter sent there forthwith.   rmm

Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for plea hearing.  Defense would like a short adjournment as the parties are still negotiating.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Maurice Adidas Campbell in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense counsel requests a projected guilty plea date in Branch 40.
  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Maurice Adidas Campbell in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Maurice Adidas Campbell in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
